intro: Quercus lipacon, commonly known as the Chinese white oak, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. The tree is characterized by its lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall and its production of acorns. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers temperate climates. Quercus lipacon plays an important role in its native ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
